title: Seeing Beneath Dense Forest Canopies
subtitle: Under-Canopy Terrain Reconstruction in Dense Forests Using RGB Imaging and Neural 3D Reconstruction
description: WACV 2026 Workshop (CV4EO) paper on under-canopy terrain reconstruction in dense forests using RGB imaging and neural 3D reconstruction.
abstract: We present a NeRF-based pipeline that reconstructs canopy-free, photorealistic ground views using only conventional RGB drone images. We formalize capture considerations (near-nadir, high overlap/density, fine GSD, and especially diffuse light), adopt a low-light loss, and propose two complementary canopy removal approaches: DTM-based volumetric clipping and segmentation-based filtering. We demonstrate downstream tasks: search-and-rescue person detection and forest inventory (tree stem counting).
contributions: RGB-only under-canopy terrain/understory rendering via differentiable volumetric reconstruction (NeRF).
Capture protocol + illumination guidance; diffuse light recommended; adopt low-light (RAW) loss to emphasize dark pixels.
Two canopy removal modes: (a) DTM height-based cropping (ground-only integration) and (b) segmentation-based masking.
Downstream validation: person detection (SAR) and tree stem counting.

steps: Capture dense RGB imagery under the canopy
Run SfM/Bundle Adjustment to estimate camera poses
Render ground-only views with canopy removal
